comments.body: I'm not sure how this will handle being rolled into google3. I got away with the network_image case by ignoring that file in the BUILD config

I'm not sure how the google3 setup is, but the way I see it working is that this package will only be pulled in for Flutter web application builds. So, for plugins, there will be two targets, one `dart_library` for the client library, and one for the web-implementation (which will depend on `package:flutter_web_plugins`).

Since this is a new package and fairly constrained in scope, you should shoot for close to 100% test coverage. This will make it much easier for new contributors to add on as needed if there are a lot of existing test cases. (We'd need to execute it with -p chrome, but that should be okay long term)
Added some tests. However, I have to skip them until `webOnlySetPluginHandler` lands in the Flutter SDK engine.
